activities.name: St. Patrick's Festival
activities.description: Join the vibrant St. Patrick's Festival, a celebration of Irish culture with parades, music, and performances throughout Dublin.
activities.seasonal_notes: This iconic festival takes place every March, marking the arrival of spring with a burst of green and Irish pride.
activities.booking_tips: Arrive early for the best view of the parade and check the festival's website for a schedule of events.

activities.name: Phoenix Park
activities.description: Explore the expansive Phoenix Park, one of the largest urban parks in Europe, perfect for picnics and leisurely walks.
activities.seasonal_notes: Spring flowers and mild weather make it an ideal time to enjoy the park's natural beauty.
activities.booking_tips: No booking required. Consider renting a bike to explore more of the park.

activities.name: Dublin Bay Prawn Festival
activities.description: Indulge in the local seafood delicacies at the Dublin Bay Prawn Festival, featuring culinary demonstrations and tasting events.
activities.seasonal_notes: Held in April, this festival celebrates the fresh catch of the season.
activities.booking_tips: Tickets for special events should be purchased in advance. Check local listings for event details.

activities.name: Dublin Writers Museum
activities.description: Discover the rich literary history of Dublin at the Dublin Writers Museum, celebrating famous Irish authors.
activities.seasonal_notes: Spring showers can make this indoor attraction a cozy retreat.
activities.booking_tips: Tickets can be purchased at the door, but mornings tend to be less crowded.

activities.name: Howth Cliff Walk
activities.description: Enjoy stunning coastal views and fresh sea air on the Howth Cliff Walk, a popular trail just outside Dublin.
activities.seasonal_notes: Clear spring days provide the best visibility for ocean vistas.
activities.booking_tips: Wear sturdy shoes and check the weather forecast before setting out.

activities.name: National Botanic Gardens
activities.description: Visit the National Botanic Gardens to see diverse plant species in bloom, from native flora to exotic collections.
activities.seasonal_notes: Spring is the perfect time to witness the gardens in full bloom.
activities.booking_tips: Admission is free; guided tours are available for a small fee and can enhance your visit.

activities.name: Irish Film Institute
activities.description: Catch a screening at the Irish Film Institute, showcasing Irish and international films in a historic setting.
activities.seasonal_notes: Spring evenings can be chilly, making this a cozy, cultural retreat.
activities.booking_tips: Book tickets online to secure seats for popular screenings.

activities.name: Dublin Castle
activities.description: Explore Dublin Castle, an iconic historical complex with guided tours that delve into Ireland's past.
activities.seasonal_notes: The castle's indoor spaces provide a warm escape from occasional spring rains.
activities.booking_tips: Guided tour tickets can be purchased online to avoid queues.

activities.name: Bloomsday Festival
activities.description: Celebrate James Joyce's 'Ulysses' with readings, performances, and walking tours on Bloomsday, June 16th.
activities.seasonal_notes: Summer weather enhances the outdoor festivities celebrating Dublin's literary heritage.
activities.booking_tips: Join a guided walking tour for a comprehensive experience; book early as these are popular.

activities.name: Trinity College and the Book of Kells
activities.description: Visit Trinity College to see the stunning Book of Kells and explore the historic campus.
activities.seasonal_notes: Summer mornings are perfect for avoiding the larger tourist crowds.
activities.booking_tips: Pre-book tickets online, as this is a must-see attraction with limited daily entries.

activities.name: Dublin Zoo
activities.description: Spend a day at Dublin Zoo in Phoenix Park, home to a wide variety of animals from around the world.
activities.seasonal_notes: Warm weather makes it enjoyable to explore the outdoor exhibits.
activities.booking_tips: Buy tickets online to avoid queues; arrive early to see animals at their most active.

activities.name: River Liffey Kayaking
activities.description: Experience Dublin from a unique perspective by kayaking on the River Liffey.
activities.seasonal_notes: Long summer days provide more daylight for this adventurous activity.
activities.booking_tips: Book a guided tour in advance and wear appropriate water gear.

activities.name: Dublin Horse Show
activities.description: Attend the Dublin Horse Show, a premier equestrian event featuring show jumping, shopping, and entertainment.
activities.seasonal_notes: Held in August, it's a highlight of Dublin's summer social calendar.
activities.booking_tips: Purchase tickets well in advance, especially for prime seating areas.

activities.name: Malahide Castle and Gardens
activities.description: Explore Malahide Castle and its beautiful gardens, offering a glimpse into Ireland's medieval past.
activities.seasonal_notes: Summer is ideal for enjoying the gardens in full bloom.
activities.booking_tips: Guided tours can be booked online; consider a picnic in the gardens.

activities.name: Temple Bar Nightlife
activities.description: Experience Dublin's vibrant nightlife in the Temple Bar district, known for its pubs and live music.
activities.seasonal_notes: Mild summer nights make it ideal for enjoying outdoor pub terraces.
activities.booking_tips: Visit popular spots early to avoid long lines and secure a table.

activities.name: Dublin Bay Cruises
activities.description: Take a scenic cruise on Dublin Bay, offering stunning views of the coast and city skyline.
activities.seasonal_notes: Summer's clear skies enhance the panoramic views from the water.
activities.booking_tips: Reserve tickets online for your desired date and time, as cruises can fill up quickly.

activities.name: Dublin Theatre Festival
activities.description: Attend the Dublin Theatre Festival, showcasing innovative performances from local and international companies.
activities.seasonal_notes: Held in September and October, it offers a cultural escape as the weather cools.
activities.booking_tips: Purchase tickets for popular shows well in advance.

activities.name: Dublin Fringe Festival
activities.description: Experience the Dublin Fringe Festival, a celebration of arts and culture with diverse performances across the city.
activities.seasonal_notes: Autumn's cooler evenings make indoor performances inviting.
activities.booking_tips: Check the festival's website for a schedule and book tickets early.

activities.name: Halloween at Bram Stoker Festival
activities.description: Celebrate Halloween at the Bram Stoker Festival, with gothic events inspired by the famous Irish author.
activities.seasonal_notes: Held in October, it captures the spooky spirit of the season.
activities.booking_tips: Some events require tickets; check the festival's program for details.

activities.name: Kilmainham Gaol
activities.description: Visit Kilmainham Gaol, a former prison with a rich history tied to Ireland's struggle for independence.
activities.seasonal_notes: Autumn's reflective mood complements this poignant historical site.
activities.booking_tips: Guided tours are popular, so book online to secure a spot.

activities.name: Dublin Flea Market
activities.description: Browse the Dublin Flea Market for unique finds, from vintage clothing to handcrafted goods.
activities.seasonal_notes: Cooler autumn days make this outdoor market a pleasant outing.
activities.booking_tips: Bring cash as not all vendors accept cards.

activities.name: National Gallery of Ireland
activities.description: Explore the National Gallery of Ireland, home to an extensive collection of European and Irish art.
activities.seasonal_notes: Autumn rains make this indoor attraction an ideal cultural retreat.
activities.booking_tips: Admission is free; consider joining a guided tour for deeper insights.

activities.name: Guinness Storehouse
activities.description: Tour the Guinness Storehouse to learn about Ireland's iconic stout and enjoy panoramic views from the Gravity Bar.
activities.seasonal_notes: Autumn's cooler climate makes indoor attractions more appealing.
activities.booking_tips: Pre-book tickets online to skip the queues and ensure entry.

activities.name: Dublin Ghostbus Tour
activities.description: Embark on a ghostbus tour of Dublin, exploring the city's haunted sites with a blend of history and horror.
activities.seasonal_notes: The eerie atmosphere of autumn nights enhances the spooky experience.
activities.booking_tips: Book tickets in advance as tours can sell out, especially near Halloween.

activities.name: Dublin at Christmas
activities.description: Experience the festive holiday lights and markets across Dublin, including the annual Christmas lights switch-on ceremony.
activities.seasonal_notes: Winter transforms the city into a festive wonderland with twinkling lights and decorations.
activities.booking_tips: Arrive early for the lights ceremony for a good spot; check local listings for market dates.

activities.name: New Year's Festival Dublin
activities.description: Ring in the New Year with concerts, fireworks, and cultural events as part of Dublin's New Year's Festival.
activities.seasonal_notes: Celebrate the New Year with the vibrant energy of winter festivities.
activities.booking_tips: Some events may require tickets; check the festival's program for details.

activities.name: Ice Skating at Dundrum on Ice
activities.description: Enjoy ice skating at Dundrum on Ice, a popular winter attraction for all ages.
activities.seasonal_notes: Winter's chill sets the perfect stage for this traditional ice skating experience.
activities.booking_tips: Book tickets online to secure your preferred time slot, especially during weekends.

activities.name: Little Museum of Dublin
activities.description: Visit the Little Museum of Dublin to learn about the city's history through quirky exhibits and guided tours.
activities.seasonal_notes: Winter's cold weather makes indoor museums a cozy and informative retreat.
activities.booking_tips: Tours often sell out, so book in advance or arrive early.

activities.name: Dublin Castle Christmas Market
activities.description: Shop for unique gifts and enjoy festive treats at the Dublin Castle Christmas Market.
activities.seasonal_notes: The market's festive ambiance is perfect for getting into the holiday spirit.
activities.booking_tips: Check market opening times as they vary throughout December.

activities.name: National Leprechaun Museum
activities.description: Explore Irish folklore at the National Leprechaun Museum, dedicated to the tales and mythology of Ireland.
activities.seasonal_notes: Winter afternoons are ideal for diving into indoor attractions with a magical twist.
activities.booking_tips: Book online for guided tours to ensure a spot, especially during school holidays.

activities.name: Christ Church Cathedral
activities.description: Visit Christ Church Cathedral, a stunning medieval landmark with a rich history and beautiful architecture.
activities.seasonal_notes: The cathedral's warm interior offers a peaceful escape from winter's chill.
activities.booking_tips: Check for special events or concerts during the holiday season.

activities.name: Whiskey Tasting at Teeling Distillery
activities.description: Warm up with a whiskey tasting tour at Teeling Distillery, learning about Dublin's distilling traditions.
activities.seasonal_notes: Winter is perfect for savoring the rich flavors of Irish whiskey.
activities.booking_tips: Tours are popular; book online to secure your preferred time.
